title: The week in tennis: Zverev wins in Paris, and the ATP Finals spots are locked in
description: With Djokovic out, the last three ATP Finals spots have been determined, while Zverev had a big victory in France this week.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: Unflappable to unstoppable? Pegula ready for WTA Finals challenge
description: After a roller-coaster season of injuries, coaching changes and a finals appearance at the US Open, Jessica Pegula has big goals for the WTA Finals.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: #NextGenATP Michelsen ends Gasquet's fairytale run in Metz
description: Alex Michelsen had little time for sentiment on Tuesday at the Moselle Open. The #NextGenATP star rallied from the brink of defeat to secure a thrilling comeback victory over Richard Gasquet, ending the Frenchman‚Äôs fairytale final run in Metz. Michelsen saved two match points in the deciding-set tie-break before sealing a 6-7(4), 7-6(3), 7-6(8) triumph. ‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt really thinking, I was just playing,‚Äù said Michelsen, who is second in the PIF ATP Live Race To Jeddah. ‚ÄúI felt super calm in the pressure moments and I think that was why I came through. I was down two match points and I found two winners.‚Äù [ATP APP] In an absorbing battle, it was Michelsen who held his nerve, striking 65 winners en route to his seventh quarter-final of 2024. The 20-year-old will next face either Buyunchaokete or qualifier Jesper de Jong for a place in the last four. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs been doing it for 20 years and he is still that good,‚Äù Michelsen added of Gasquet, who is retiring at the conclusion of Roland Garros 2025. ‚ÄúHe's an incredible player. I knew it was going to be a tough battle. All the credit to him for competing as hard as he could.‚Äù Gasquet, who made the first of his 33 ATP Tour finals in Metz, was bidding to become the oldest quarter-finalist in tournament history. The 38-year-old had the match on his racket at 6/4 in the final set tie-break, but Michelsen produced some inspired tennis to cross the line. Earlier, it seemed as if the news that Andrey Rublev had qualified for the Nitto ATP Finals might just have been his tonic. The top seed at the indoor ATP 250 dialled in for a hard-fought 7-6(3), 7-5 win over Lorenzo Sonego, the 2022 champion. In a battle dominated by the server, Rublev found the only break of the match to seal a one-hour, 52-minute victory. ‚ÄúIt was a tough match, he is playing really well, he beat me the last two times,‚Äù said Rublev, who levelled the pair‚Äôs Lexus ATP Head2Head series at 2-2. ‚ÄúWith the way he serves, and how he plays with the forehand, it‚Äôs really tough to play against him. The first set could have gone either way, but as soon as I had a chance, I was able to take it.‚Äù Rublev has since withdrawn from the main draw citing abdominal pain, meaning that Corentin Moutet will advance straight to the semi-finals. Buoyed by the crowd, the Frenchman found some inspired tennis to defeat Jan-Lennard Struff 7-6(2), 5-7, 6-3. Moutet was particularly dialled in during the final set, during which he carved out eight break points, according to Infosys ATP Stats.¬† [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Lehecka passes Cilic test in Belgrade: 'He hasn't forgotten how to play'
description: Jiri Lehecka delivered a statement performance against Marin Cilic on Tuesday at the Belgrade Open to serve up some Czech history. The fourth seed powered to a 6-4, 7-6(4) victory, becoming the first Czech player to reach seven ATP Tour quarter-finals in one season since Tomas Berdych in 2017. With the one-hour, 43-minute win, Lehecka extended his perfect record against opponents outside the Top 100 in the PIF ATP Rankings to 8-0. ‚ÄúHe didn‚Äôt forget how to play,‚Äù Lehecka said of Cilic, the former World No. 3. ‚ÄúWe saw that today, it was a good test for me. It‚Äôs always a good win against a very experienced player, a Grand Slam champion, so I‚Äôm very happy.‚Äù [ATP APP] Lehecka was ruthless on serve throughout the match, during which he won 89 per cent (33/37) points behind his first delivery, according to Infosys ATP Stats. In the last eight, the 22-year-old will face qualifier Lukas Klein, who earlier upset seventh seed Tomas Martin Etcheverry 6-4, 7-6(8). Elsewhere, Hamad Medjedovic continued his return to form with a hard-fought win over Aleksandar Kovacevic to advance to his third tour-level quarter-final. The wild card did not face a single break point, en route to a 7-6(5), 6-4 triumph. Say hello to your first quarter-finalist in Belgrade üëã üá∑üá∏@MedjedovicHamad is through to his 3‚É£rd ATP QF with a straight sets win over Kovacevic 7-6(5) 6-4#BelgradeOpen pic.twitter.com/G1xWG6keMl ‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) November 5, 2024 ‚ÄúI was a bit tight in my first match [against Brandon Nakashima]," said Medjedovic, the reigning Next Gen ATP Finals presented by PIF champion. ‚ÄúBut now I have got into the rhythm, I am feeling great with the home crowd and I‚Äôm really enjoying it.‚Äù Medjedovic will face either third seed Francisco Cerundolo or Roman Safiullin, who earlier secured his 50th tour-level win by defeating Fabio Fognini 6-3, 6-3. On a day of Serbian success, Laslo Djere won the battle of two wild cards with a commanding 6-4, 6-4 victory over Stan Wawrinka. The 29-year-old, who notched his third tour-level win on home soil, will face lucky loser Duje Ajdukovic in the second round. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Gauff advances at Finals with rare win over Swiatek
description: Coco Gauff confirms her semi-final spot at the WTA Finals with a rare win over defending champion Iga Swiatek.

title: Djokovic pulls out of ATP Finals because of injury
description: Defending champion Novak Djokovic pulls out of the ATP Finals because of injury, a move which sets the eight-man field for the event.

author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: The Best Tennis Players Do These 3 Things - Essential Tennis Podcast #412
description: If you want to be a great tennis player then you MUST do the three things revealed in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, PERIOD. The best players on your local courts do them and the weakest ones don‚Äôt, so don‚Äôt miss any of these insights because they‚Äôll level up your game fast.

title: Wilson RF 01 Playtest and Review
description: In this review, I explore the RF 01, a racket designed by Roger Federer to bring elements of his game to a broader audience. Wilson says it‚Äôs the line of rackets Federer would have used if he had successfully recovered from knee surgery in 2021. Sadly, we all know that never happened, so we can‚Äôt ‚Ä¶
author: Martina

title: Zverev Humbles Humbert with Paris Masters Victory
description: Alexander Zverev silenced the French crowd on Sunday, producing a clinical performance to defeat Ugo Humbert 6-2 6-2. Humbert was bidding to become the first homegrown Paris Masters winner since Jo-Wilfried Tsonga in 2008, but he never got close. Even though he likes to fist pump after winning the most trivial of points, he struggled ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan
